fields.description:
I've found the cause of the issue where sometimes the root volume cannot be deleted and is stuck in 'deleting' when using VMware with Netapp/EMC.

During instance teardown the broker is trying to detach the static iscsi target (iqn) on the ESX host. This is not the right behavior in all cases or for all SANs. For EMC and Netapp all volumes share the same static target (one per network path) and so removal of the luns from the session is sufficient. Removing the static target will actually disconnect *all* LUNS connected to the ESX host rather than just those associated with the instance being terminated.

In the case where many ebs-instances are terminated the first termination and LUN deletion (on SC) succeeds because it tears down that static target on the ESX host, but subsequent teardown operations fail when they too try to teardown the target but it is already gone. This causes the broker to skip part of the teardown and never call UnexportVolume on the SC which means that the volume cannot be deleted because it is exported and the SC will not delete because it is unsafe.

We would only see this behavior when terminating multiple ebs-instances and/or other ebs-instances/volumes are connected to the same ESX host AND the SAN is EMC or Netapp. Also, if another instance/volume is attached between detach or termination operations then we would not see the error because the target gets re-added to the host during that process.

This is the error seen in the cloud-debug.log on the Broker host:

The solution to this problem is to put the proper check in place, just as we have in the regular volume detach path on the Broker. This was my omission when redoing the Broker EBS bits.

The check should determine if a specific LUN >=0 is being detached (our TGT and Equallogic backends send LUN = -1) and if so, not remove the static target entry on the ESX host.

I have implemented this change (as well as better logging and error checks around this code) and am testing it now on a VMWware +EMC configuration.

comments.body:
'Testing' commit: 2dddcc6886dda6d10fc70da2edc1520235fd4097

Changes in VsphereEndpoint.destroyInstance() only.

Puts the UnexportVolume() call in a finally block and correctly detects if the iscsi target is shared or not just as is done on doDetach().

Tested on Vmware+EMC.
